When I saw people getting mad over the cars steering like [fecal matter] and the pedestrians and other motorists being too chaotic and lolrandom, and the tests being too easy to flop for "[bovine fecal matter] reasons" I knew this was exactly what I needed for my test the day after tomorrow. And indeed, it is very realistic! All except for the chunky and clunky steering (my instructors awesome mid-10s Audi A3 1.5L TDI steers so well I have to barely even think before it does what I want it to, like an overexcited horse, speaking as a former horse rider)

but yes, as someone who has dumped a category B driving license practical test in Denmark two times, I can say that it is accurate, with some bruh moments. Wish I could, for extra accuracy, permit rolling stops (stopping at inverted triangle signs is only necessary if there is bad sight or passing traffic and rolling stop offenses are technically illegal but not enforced, and you are trained to perform rolling stops when clear and safe to keep traffic flowing here)
also dumping because light turns red outside (and the green light blniking instead of turning yellow then red is also inaccurate for a lot of parts of the EU)

in any case, I thank the russians for this absolutely intense case of wonderfully executed "slavjank" (poor graphics, kinda weird physics, weird design but amazing atmosphere) and for providing the first piece of "IRL useful" slavjank I have ever seen or played.

negative.review: A good game to start hating driving before ever starting. The ingame logic is so... interesting that it¬¥s har to play the game more then 20 minutes. E.g. if you stop at a traffic light¬¥s and there are 2 cars in front of you, you will not be able to pass the intersection during the next green light! Why? Because the bot cars think so slowly! And after waiting at this traffic light you will have another one in 30 meters! Basically you learn to wait most of the time which is certainly good but not for a car simulator. If waitin in a traffic jam (consisting of 3 cars!) for like 20-30% of your game time  is not enough stress, do not worry, the game has more to offer: if you are driving with a passenger and a pedestrian runs into your car ("an emergency situation") and you avoid them by braking, you get rating penalty for sudden braking! Indeed every paseenger would give you low rating for avoiding killing a person in front of them... bevause you had to brake!

I like the game- but it's simply not made well what so ever.

Car AI is stupid af, randomly stopping in the middle of intersections, lanes, narrow bridges, driving either half or double the speed limit.
The AI is just absolutely terrible and can't even follow the same rules that you the player are forced to.

The rules you must follow don't even make sense majority of the time, you'll get punished for things that are perfectly legal,
All of this combined makes completing missions almost impossible 99% of the time, and makes it come down to RNG and luck instead of the players driving ability.

These blaring issues have been talked about since the game came out, yet still persist.
And instead of just improving the game the devs will only tell you to "provide video of what happened"
For a game that is supposed to accurately depict driving in real life- it fails miserably.

I really hope CCD2 addresses these issues and offers a far better driving experience.
